pullRequest.title: Core - created display name heuristic
pullRequest.bodyText:
There were some known problems with parsing display name. If the name
contained a middle name, it was not parsed properly. Also, sometimes the
display name contained first name and last name in reverse order.
Sometimes, it is possible to improve this, if the IDP send sn(surname)
and given name of the user.
Now, if the idp did sent the information, the parser tries to match
these values (also in reverse order). If is succeedes it tries to parse
titles and middle name.

* Sometimes, it is possible to improve this, if the IDP send sn(surname)

* Now, if the idp did sent the information, the parser tries to match
these values (also in reverse order). If is succeedes it tries to parse
titles and middle name.

nodes.bodyText: Not necessarily in this pull-request, but we might want to improve updateUserNameTitles(Application app) too, since it parses displayName form the form in order to get and update titles before/after. It might work better if we use new matching against first/last name regexes from getNamesPattern().
We already have these constants few lines below. But you can update them to your format/style which is correct.

commit.message:
Core - created display name heuristic

* There were some known problems with parsing display name. If the name
contained a middle name, it was not parsed properly. Also, sometimes the
display name contained first name and last name in reverse order.
* Sometimes, it is possible to improve this, if the IDP send sn(surname)
and given name of the user.
* Now, if the idp did sent the information, the parser tries to match
these values (also in reverse order). If is succeedes it tries to parse
titles and middle name.
